title: NASA weighs changes to Artemis 3 if key elements are delayed
summary: NASA has left the door open for changing the scope of Artemis 3, currently set to be the first crewed lunar landing of the program, if key elements suffer major delays.

title: Download your Wednesday ‘News from the 2023 Small Satellite show’ digital edition
summary: The SpaceNews editorial team is producing a daily for the 2023 Small Satellite show, a nightly email newsletter and all-day web coverage during the 2023 Small Satellite show in Logan, Utah, the […]

title: Solestial To Equip Atomos Space Tugs With Solar Arrays
summary: Solar energy startup, Solestial, has unveiled its plans to provide solar arrays for space tugs developed by Denver-based startup Atomos Space.

title: NRO seeks collaboration with industry and academia
summary: The National Reconnaissance Office is looking for partners who are developing advanced technology for satellites and ground systems.

title: KSAT Announces Automated Ka-band Network
summary: Kongsberg Satellite Services (KSAT) has announced an automated Ka-band ground network engineered to serve the evolving needs of small satellite constellations.
